DocFullTitle: Registration, Evaluation, Authorisation and Restriction of Chemicals
Organization: European Parliament|Council of the European Union
ActionRequired: THE articles in quantities totalling less 1t/y per: EU producers or importers of articles which contain substances on the SVHC list in a concentration above 0.1% (w/w) have to provide sufficient information to their customers to allow safe use of the article as soon as the substances are included or, upon request, to a consumer within 45 days of the receipt of the request. THE articles in quantities totalling over 1t/y per: 1) A notification has to be submitted no later than 6 months after its inclusion; 2)A notification is not required for a substance in articles which have been produced or imported before the substance has been included on the SVHC list. 3)According the latest ruling of the European Court of Justice (ECJ), the 0.1% threshold for notifying SVHCs in articles applies to “each of the articles incorporated as a component of a complex product” rather than to the entire article. 4) The obligation to notify substances in articles also applies to packaging materials. Packaging is to be assessed separately from any object it contains.
